content:
TITLE: Building Docker Stack with Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: Command to build the Docker stack for local development using docker-compose. This builds all the services defined in the docker-compose.local.yml file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally-docker.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting up Django Project on Heroku
DESCRIPTION: A comprehensive bash script to deploy a cookiecutter-django project to Heroku. Includes creating a Heroku app, setting up PostgreSQL database, Redis, Mailgun, configuring essential environment variables, and pushing the project to Heroku.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/3-deployment/deployment-on-heroku.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
heroku create --buildpack heroku/python

# Note: this is not a free plan
heroku addons:create heroku-postgresql:essential-0

# On Windows use double quotes for the time zone, e.g.
# heroku pg:backups schedule --at "02:00 America/Los_Angeles" DATABASE_URL
heroku pg:backups schedule --at '02:00 America/Los_Angeles' DATABASE_URL
heroku pg:promote DATABASE_URL

heroku addons:create heroku-redis:mini

# Assuming you chose Mailgun as mail service (see below for others)
heroku addons:create mailgun:starter

heroku config:set DJANGO_DEBUG=False
heroku config:set DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE=config.settings.production
heroku config:set DJANGO_SECRET_KEY="$(openssl rand -base64 64)"

# Generating a 32 character-long random string without any of the visually similar characters "IOl01":
heroku config:set DJANGO_ADMIN_URL="$(openssl rand -base64 4096 | tr -dc 'A-HJ-NP-Za-km-z2-9' | head -c 32)/"

# Set this to your Heroku app url, e.g. 'bionic-beaver-28392.herokuapp.com'
heroku config:set DJANGO_ALLOWED_HOSTS=

# Assign with AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
heroku config:set DJANGO_AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=

# Assign with AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
heroku config:set DJANGO_AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=

# Assign with AWS_STORAGE_BUCKET_NAME
heroku config:set DJANGO_AWS_STORAGE_BUCKET_NAME=

git push heroku main

heroku run python manage.py createsuperuser

heroku run python manage.py check --deploy

heroku open
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Core and Conditional Python Dependencies for Cookiecutter Django
DESCRIPTION: This requirements file defines all necessary Python packages for a Cookiecutter Django project. It includes base dependencies like Django and Pillow, and conditional dependencies that are included based on template variables such as frontend_pipeline, use_docker, use_celery, use_async, and use_drf.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/{{cookiecutter.project_slug}}/requirements/base.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
python-slugify==8.0.4  # https://github.com/un33k/python-slugify
Pillow==11.1.0 # pyup: != 11.2.0  # https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow
{%- if cookiecutter.frontend_pipeline == 'Django Compressor' %}
{%- if cookiecutter.windows == 'y' and cookiecutter.use_docker == 'n' %}
rcssmin==1.1.2 --install-option="--without-c-extensions"  # https://github.com/ndparker/rcssmin
{%- else %}
rcssmin==1.1.2  # https://github.com/ndparker/rcssmin
{%- endif %}
{%- endif %}
argon2-cffi==23.1.0  # https://github.com/hynek/argon2_cffi
{%- if cookiecutter.use_whitenoise == 'y' %}
whitenoise==6.9.0  # https://github.com/evansd/whitenoise
{%- endif %}
redis==5.2.1  # https://github.com/redis/redis-py
{%- if cookiecutter.use_docker == "y" or cookiecutter.windows == "n" %}
hiredis==3.1.0  # https://github.com/redis/hiredis-py
{%- endif %}
{%- if cookiecutter.use_celery == "y" %}
celery==5.5.0  # pyup: < 6.0  # https://github.com/celery/celery
django-celery-beat==2.7.0  # https://github.com/celery/django-celery-beat
{%- if cookiecutter.use_docker == 'y' %}
flower==2.0.1  # https://github.com/mher/flower
{%- endif %}
{%- endif %}
{%- if cookiecutter.use_async == 'y' %}
uvicorn[standard]==0.34.0  # https://github.com/encode/uvicorn
uvicorn-worker==0.3.0  # https://github.com/Kludex/uvicorn-worker
{%- endif %}

# Django
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
django==5.1.8  # pyup: < 5.2 # https://www.djangoproject.com/
django-environ==0.12.0  # https://github.com/joke2k/django-environ
django-model-utils==5.0.0  # https://github.com/jazzband/django-model-utils
django-allauth[mfa]==65.7.0  # https://github.com/pennersr/django-allauth
django-crispy-forms==2.3  # https://github.com/django-crispy-forms/django-crispy-forms
crispy-bootstrap5==2025.4  # https://github.com/django-crispy-forms/crispy-bootstrap5
{%- if cookiecutter.frontend_pipeline == 'Django Compressor' %}
django-compressor==4.5.1  # https://github.com/django-compressor/django-compressor
{%- endif %}
django-redis==5.4.0  # https://github.com/jazzband/django-redis
{%- if cookiecutter.use_drf == 'y' %}
# Django REST Framework
djangorestframework==3.16.0  # https://github.com/encode/django-rest-framework
django-cors-headers==4.7.0  # https://github.com/adamchainz/django-cors-headers
# DRF-spectacular for api documentation
drf-spectacular==0.28.0  # https://github.com/tfranzel/drf-spectacular
{%- endif %}
{%- if cookiecutter.frontend_pipeline == 'Webpack' %}
django-webpack-loader==3.1.1  # https://github.com/django-webpack/django-webpack-loader
{%- endif %}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating New Django Project from Template
DESCRIPTION: Command to generate a new Django project using the Cookiecutter Django template from GitHub repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ cookiecutter https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating a new cookiecutter-django project using command line
DESCRIPTION: This command uses cookiecutter to generate a new Django project from the cookiecutter-django template on GitHub. It creates a project scaffold with all the necessary files and directory structure based on the template.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/generate-project-block.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ cookiecutter gh:cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Cookiecutter CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the Cookiecutter CLI tool version 1.7.0 or higher using pip package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ pip install "cookiecutter>=1.7.0"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Django Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Commands to start the Django development server either synchronously with runserver or asynchronously with uvicorn depending on the project configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ python manage.py runserver 0.0.0.0:8000
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ uvicorn config.asgi:application --host 0.0.0.0 --reload --reload-include '*.html'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating and Activating a Python Virtual Environment
DESCRIPTION: Commands to create a Python 3.12 virtual environment and activate it for isolating the project dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ python3.12 -m venv <virtual env path>
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ source <virtual env path>/bin/activate
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Docker Stack for Local Development
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Docker containers for local development. This brings up both Django and PostgreSQL services.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally-docker.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml up
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Git Pre-commit Hooks
DESCRIPTION: Commands to initialize a git repository and install pre-commit hooks. This ensures code quality checks run automatically before each commit.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally-docker.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ git init
$ pre-commit install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Applying Database Migrations
DESCRIPTION: Command to run Django migrations to set up the database schema required by the application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ python manage.py migrate
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Docker Compose for Production
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the command to build and run the Docker Compose stack for production. It includes variations for detached mode, running migrations, creating a superuser, and scaling services.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/3-deployment/deployment-with-docker.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker compose -f docker-compose.production.yml build
docker compose -f docker-compose.production.yml up
docker compose -f docker-compose.production.yml up -d
docker compose -f docker-compose.production.yml run --rm django python manage.py migrate
docker compose -f docker-compose.production.yml run --rm django python manage.py createsuperuser
docker compose -f docker-compose.production.yml run --rm django python manage.py shell
docker compose -f docker-compose.production.yml logs
docker compose -f docker-compose.production.yml up --scale django=4
docker compose -f docker-compose.production.yml up --scale celeryworker=2
docker compose -f docker-compose.production.yml ps
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Production Dependencies for Django Project
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the production dependencies for a Django project. It includes core packages like gunicorn and psycopg, and conditionally includes other packages based on project configuration such as cloud provider, mail service, and specific features like Sentry integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/{{cookiecutter.project_slug}}/requirements/production.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
# PRECAUTION: avoid production dependencies that aren't in development

-r base.txt

gunicorn==23.0.0  # https://github.com/benoitc/gunicorn
psycopg[c]==3.2.6  # https://github.com/psycopg/psycopg
{%- if cookiecutter.use_whitenoise == 'n'and cookiecutter.cloud_provider in ('AWS', 'GCP') %}
Collectfasta==3.2.1  # https://github.com/jasongi/collectfasta
{%- endif %}
{%- if cookiecutter.use_sentry == "y" %}
sentry-sdk==2.25.1  # https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-python
{%- endif %}
{%- if cookiecutter.use_docker == "n" and cookiecutter.windows == "y" %}
hiredis==3.1.0  # https://github.com/redis/hiredis-py
{%- endif %}

# Django
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
{%- if cookiecutter.cloud_provider == 'AWS' %}
django-storages[s3]==1.14.6  # https://github.com/jschneier/django-storages
{%- elif cookiecutter.cloud_provider == 'GCP' %}
django-storages[google]==1.14.6  # https://github.com/jschneier/django-storages
{%- elif cookiecutter.cloud_provider == 'Azure' %}
django-storages[azure]==1.14.6  # https://github.com/jschneier/django-storages
{%- endif %}
{%- if cookiecutter.mail_service == 'Mailgun' %}
django-anymail[mailgun]==13.0  # https://github.com/anymail/django-anymail
{%- elif cookiecutter.mail_service == 'Amazon SES' %}
django-anymail[amazon-ses]==13.0  # https://github.com/anymail/django-anymail
{%- elif cookiecutter.mail_service == 'Mailjet' %}
django-anymail[mailjet]==13.0  # https://github.com/anymail/django-anymail
{%- elif cookiecutter.mail_service == 'Mandrill' %}
django-anymail[mandrill]==13.0  # https://github.com/anymail/django-anymail
{%- elif cookiecutter.mail_service == 'Postmark' %}
django-anymail[postmark]==13.0  # https://github.com/anymail/django-anymail
{%- elif cookiecutter.mail_service == 'Sendgrid' %}
django-anymail[sendgrid]==13.0  # https://github.com/anymail/django-anymail
{%- elif cookiecutter.mail_service == 'Brevo' %}
django-anymail[brevo]==13.0  # https://github.com/anymail/django-anymail
{%- elif cookiecutter.mail_service == 'SparkPost' %}
django-anymail[sparkpost]==13.0  # https://github.com/anymail/django-anymail
{%- elif cookiecutter.mail_service == 'Other SMTP' %}
django-anymail==13.0  # https://github.com/anymail/django-anymail
{%- endif %}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Restoring PostgreSQL from Existing Backup with Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: This command restores the PostgreSQL database from an existing backup file using Docker Compose. It executes the 'restore' command inside the postgres container with the specified backup file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/4-guides/docker-postgres-backups.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml exec postgres restore backup_2018_03_13T09_05_07.sql.gz
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Development Dependencies for Cookiecutter Django Project
DESCRIPTION: This requirements file extends the production requirements and specifies additional packages needed for development environments. It includes debugging tools, testing frameworks, documentation generators, and code quality tools with conditional inclusions based on project configuration options like Docker usage, async capabilities, and DRF implementation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/{{cookiecutter.project_slug}}/requirements/local.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: pip
CODE:
```
-r production.txt

Werkzeug[watchdog]==3.1.3 # https://github.com/pallets/werkzeug
ipdb==0.13.13  # https://github.com/gotcha/ipdb
{%- if cookiecutter.use_docker == 'y' %}
psycopg[c]==3.2.6  # https://github.com/psycopg/psycopg
{%- else %}
psycopg[binary]==3.2.6  # https://github.com/psycopg/psycopg
{%- endif %}
{%- if cookiecutter.use_async == 'y' or cookiecutter.use_celery == 'y' %}
watchfiles==1.0.4  # https://github.com/samuelcolvin/watchfiles
{%- endif %}

# Testing
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
mypy==1.15.0  # https://github.com/python/mypy
django-stubs[compatible-mypy]==5.1.3  # https://github.com/typeddjango/django-stubs
pytest==8.3.5  # https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest
pytest-sugar==1.0.0  # https://github.com/Teemu/pytest-sugar
{%- if cookiecutter.use_drf == "y" %}
djangorestframework-stubs==3.15.3  # https://github.com/typeddjango/djangorestframework-stubs
{%- endif %}

# Documentation
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
sphinx==8.2.3 # pyup: != 8.3.0  # https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx
sphinx-autobuild==2024.10.3 # https://github.com/GaretJax/sphinx-autobuild

# Code quality
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
ruff==0.11.4  # https://github.com/astral-sh/ruff
coverage==7.8.0  # https://github.com/nedbat/coveragepy
djlint==1.36.4  # https://github.com/Riverside-Healthcare/djLint
pre-commit==4.2.0  # https://github.com/pre-commit/pre-commit

# Django
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
factory-boy==3.3.2  # https://github.com/FactoryBoy/factory_boy

django-debug-toolbar==5.1.0  # https://github.com/jazzband/django-debug-toolbar
django-extensions==4.0  # https://github.com/django-extensions/django-extensions
django-coverage-plugin==3.1.0  # https://github.com/nedbat/django_coverage_plugin
pytest-django==4.11.1  # https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest-django
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Superuser Account in Django
DESCRIPTION: Command to create a superuser account in the Django project. This allows administrative access to the application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/{{cookiecutter.project_slug}}/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ python manage.py createsuperuser
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating and Configuring a New Django App
DESCRIPTION: Commands to create a new Django app, move it to the correct location within the project structure, and update its configuration to match the project's naming conventions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ python manage.py startapp <name-of-the-app>
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ mv <name-of-the-app> <django_project_root>/
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a PostgreSQL Database
DESCRIPTION: Command to create a new PostgreSQL database using the createdb utility with the project slug as the database name.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ createdb --username=postgres <project_slug>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initial Project Setup in PythonAnywhere
DESCRIPTION: Commands to clone the repository and set up a Python virtual environment with required dependencies on PythonAnywhere.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/3-deployment/deployment-on-pythonanywhere.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone <my-repo-url>  # you can also use hg
cd my-project-name
mkvirtualenv --python=/usr/bin/python3.10 my-project-name
pip install -r requirements/production.txt  # may take a few minutes
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Upgrading PostgreSQL with Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: This series of commands demonstrates the process of upgrading PostgreSQL in a Docker environment. It includes steps for stopping containers, creating a backup, removing the old data volume, rebuilding the postgres container, and restoring from backup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/4-guides/docker-postgres-backups.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml down
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml up -d postgres
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml run --rm postgres backup
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml down
docker volume rm my_project_postgres_data
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml build postgres
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml up -d postgres
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml run --rm postgres restore backup_2018_03_13T09_05_07.sql.gz
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml up -d
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Environment Variables for Database Connection
DESCRIPTION: Command to set the DATABASE_URL environment variable for connecting to the PostgreSQL database using the appropriate credentials and database name.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ export DATABASE_URL=postgres://postgres:<password>@127.0.0.1:5432/<DB name given to createdb>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Pytest in Local Development Environment
DESCRIPTION: Command to run all tests using Pytest in a local development environment. This will execute tests across the entire project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/4-guides/testing.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ pytest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Django Secret Key
DESCRIPTION: Python command to generate a secure random secret key for Django application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/3-deployment/deployment-on-pythonanywhere.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python -c 'import random;import string; print("".join(random.SystemRandom().choice(string.digits + string.ascii_letters + string.punctuation) for _ in range(50)))'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Development Requirements and Git Setup
DESCRIPTION: Commands to navigate to the project directory, install development dependencies, initialize a git repository, and set up pre-commit hooks for code quality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ cd <what you have entered as the project_slug at setup stage>
$ pip install -r requirements/local.txt
$ git init # A git repo is required for pre-commit to install
$ pre-commit install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Git Repository
DESCRIPTION: Commands to initialize a new Git repository, make the first commit, and push to a remote GitHub repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ cd reddit/
$ ls
$ git init
$ git add .
$ git commit -m "first awesome commit"
$ git remote add origin git@github.com:pydanny/redditclone.git
$ git push -u origin master
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Django with ipdb Debugging Support
DESCRIPTION: Command to run Django with service ports exposed to support interactive debugging with ipdb.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally-docker.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml run --rm --service-ports django
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Tests and Coverage in Django
DESCRIPTION: Commands to run tests, check test coverage, and generate an HTML coverage report for the Django project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/{{cookiecutter.project_slug}}/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ coverage run -m pytest
$ coverage html
$ open htmlcov/index.html
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: WSGI Configuration for PythonAnywhere
DESCRIPTION: WSGI configuration file setup with environment variables and Django application initialization.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/3-deployment/deployment-on-pythonanywhere.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import os
import sys
path = '/home/<your-username>/<your-project-directory>'
if path not in sys.path:
    sys.path.append(path)

os.environ['DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE'] = 'config.settings.production'
os.environ['DJANGO_SECRET_KEY'] = '<as above>'
os.environ['DJANGO_ALLOWED_HOSTS'] = '<as above>'
os.environ['DJANGO_ADMIN_URL'] = '<as above>'
os.environ['MAILGUN_API_KEY'] = '<as above>'
os.environ['MAILGUN_DOMAIN'] = '<as above>'
os.environ['DJANGO_AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID'] = ''
os.environ['DJANGO_AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY'] = ''
os.environ['DJANGO_AWS_STORAGE_BUCKET_NAME'] = ''
os.environ['DATABASE_URL'] = '<as above>'

from django.core.wsgi import get_wsgi_application
application = get_wsgi_application()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Uploading and Downloading PostgreSQL Backups to Amazon S3 with Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: These commands demonstrate how to upload and download PostgreSQL backups to/from Amazon S3 using the aws cli container with Docker Compose. It uses the default S3 environment variables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/4-guides/docker-postgres-backups.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker compose -f docker-compose.production.yml run --rm awscli upload
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker compose -f docker-compose.production.yml run --rm awscli download backup_2018_03_13T09_05_07.sql.gz
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Celery with Redis for Task Processing
DESCRIPTION: Python code snippet showing how to configure Celery to use Redis as a broker instead of running tasks in the main thread during development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
CELERY_TASK_ALWAYS_EAGER = False
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Celery Worker in Django Project
DESCRIPTION: Commands to run a Celery worker for background task processing in the Django project. Celery is used for handling asynchronous tasks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/{{cookiecutter.project_slug}}/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd {{cookiecutter.project_slug}}
celery -A config.celery_app worker -l info
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Documentation Service
DESCRIPTION: Commands to run the documentation service alone or combined with local services using Docker Compose.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally-docker.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ docker compose -f docker-compose.docs.yml up

$ docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml -f docker-compose.docs.yml up
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating PostgreSQL Backup with Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: This command creates a backup of the PostgreSQL database using Docker Compose. It executes the 'backup' command inside the postgres container.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/4-guides/docker-postgres-backups.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml exec postgres backup
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Type Checks with Mypy in Django
DESCRIPTION: Command to run type checks using mypy on the Django project. This helps catch type-related errors before runtime.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/{{cookiecutter.project_slug}}/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ mypy {{cookiecutter.project_slug}}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing Django Management Commands in Docker
DESCRIPTION: Commands to execute Django management commands like migrations and creating superuser inside the Docker container.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally-docker.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml run --rm django python manage.py migrate
$ docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml run --rm django python manage.py createsuperuser
```

----------------------------------------

DESCRIPTION: Command to run all tests using Pytest in a Docker-based development environment using the local Docker Compose configuration.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml run --rm django pytest
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ coverage report
```

TITLE: Running Tests with Coverage in Docker
DESCRIPTION: Command to run tests with code coverage analysis in a Docker environment using the local Docker Compose configuration.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```

```

```
./mailpit
```

```
POSTGRES_DB=<your project slug>

```

TITLE: Running Redis Server and Celery Worker
DESCRIPTION: Commands to start a Redis server for use with Celery and to run a Celery worker that processes background tasks for the Django application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_10

CODE:
```
$ redis-server
```

CODE:
```
$ celery -A config.celery_app worker --loglevel=info
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Logging Error to Sentry in Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to log an error and send it as a Sentry event in Python. It includes an example of adding extra context information to the log.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/3-deployment/deployment-with-docker.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import logging
logging.error("This event is sent to Sentry", extra={"<example_key>": "<example_value>"})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Webpack DevServer for HTTPS
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript configuration snippet for webpack's devServer section that enables WebSocket connections with the secure setup. This allows hot module replacement to work properly with the HTTPS proxy.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally-docker.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
client: {
  webSocketURL: 'auto://0.0.0.0:0/ws', // note the `:0` after `0.0.0.0`
},
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Django Management Commands for Deployment
DESCRIPTION: Commands to run migrations, collect static files, and compress assets for deployment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/3-deployment/deployment-on-pythonanywhere.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
source $VIRTUAL_ENV/bin/postactivate
python manage.py migrate
python manage.py collectstatic
# if using django-compressor:
python manage.py compress
# and, optionally
python manage.py createsuperuser
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Frontend Development with Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install JavaScript dependencies and start the development server for projects using Webpack or Gulp as the frontend pipeline, enabling live reloading and Sass compilation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm install
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm run dev
```

TITLE: Viewing Existing PostgreSQL Backups with Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: This command lists existing backups in the postgres container using Docker Compose. It executes the 'backups' command to show the contents of the /backups directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/4-guides/docker-postgres-backups.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_1

CODE:
```
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml exec postgres backups
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Ruff linting and formatting without modifications
DESCRIPTION: Commands to run Ruff's formatter and linter in non-destructive mode. The formatter shows differences that would be made, while the linter reports issues without fixing them.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/4-guides/linters.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ ruff format --diff .
$ ruff check .
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Copying PostgreSQL Backups Locally with Docker
DESCRIPTION: These commands demonstrate how to copy backups from the postgres container to a local directory using the docker cp command. It includes examples for copying all backups and a single backup file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/4-guides/docker-postgres-backups.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker cp 9c5c3f055843:/backups ./backups
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker cp 9c5c3f055843:/backups/backup_2018_03_13T09_05_07.sql.gz .
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker cp $(docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml ps -q postgres):/backups ./backups
```

DESCRIPTION: Command to run tests with code coverage analysis. This executes Pytest while tracking which lines of code are executed during testing.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ coverage run -m pytest
```

TITLE: Clearing Docker Cache for Local Development Environment
DESCRIPTION: Command to clear project-related Docker cache including volumes and images. This resolves authentication issues caused by persisted volumes with outdated credentials.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/5-help/troubleshooting.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml down --volumes --rmi all
```

```
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml up
```

TITLE: Building and Serving HTML Documentation Locally in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Command to build and serve HTML documentation using Sphinx for local development without Docker. This command should be run from the project directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/4-guides/document.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ make -C docs livehtml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: PostgreSQL Service Configuration in Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for the PostgreSQL service in docker-compose.local.yml, showing volume mounts and environment file configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally-docker.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
# ...

postgres:
  build:
    context: .
    dockerfile: ./compose/production/postgres/Dockerfile
  volumes:
    - local_postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
    - local_postgres_data_backups:/backups
  env_file:
    - ./.envs/.local/.postgres

# ...
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting COMPOSE_FILE Environment Variable
DESCRIPTION: Commands to set the COMPOSE_FILE environment variable to avoid specifying the compose file each time and then run the stack.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally-docker.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ export COMPOSE_FILE=docker-compose.local.yml

$ docker compose up
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Celery Worker on Heroku
DESCRIPTION: Command to scale up a Celery worker dyno to 1 instance on Heroku. This is needed to run asynchronous tasks in a cookiecutter-django project that uses Celery.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/3-deployment/deployment-on-heroku.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Scale dyno to 1 instance
heroku ps:scale worker=1
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Celery Tasks Using Django Shell
DESCRIPTION: Commands to enter the Django shell, import a task, and queue it for execution by the Celery worker for testing purposes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ python manage.py shell
>> from <project_slug>.users.tasks import get_users_count
>> get_users_count.delay()
```

TITLE: Running Docker Stack in Detached Mode

CODE:


TITLE: Setting up Sentry Error Tracking on Heroku

CODE:

CODE:
```
heroku config:set SENTRY_DSN=https://xxxx@sentry.io/12345
```

TITLE: Running Ruff with automatic fixes
DESCRIPTION: Commands to run Ruff's formatter and linter with automatic fixes applied. Includes a caution about the unsafe-fixes option which can potentially break code and recommends committing before running these commands.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/4-guides/linters.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```

$ ruff check --fix .
# be careful with the --unsafe-fixes option, it can break your code
$ ruff check --fix --unsafe-fixes  .
```

CODE:

```
{% if cookiecutter.use_docker == 'y' %}docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml run --rm django {% endif %}python manage.py makemessages --all --no-location
```

TITLE: Environment Variables Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Environment variables setup in virtualenv postactivate script for Django settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/3-deployment/deployment-on-pythonanywhere.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
export WEB_CONCURRENCY=4
export DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE='config.settings.production'
export DJANGO_SECRET_KEY='<secret key goes here>'
export DJANGO_ALLOWED_HOSTS='<www.your-domain.com>'
export DJANGO_ADMIN_URL='<not admin/>'
export MAILGUN_API_KEY='<mailgun key>'
export MAILGUN_DOMAIN='<mailgun sender domain (e.g. mg.yourdomain.com)>'
export DJANGO_AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=
export DJANGO_AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=
export DJANGO_AWS_STORAGE_BUCKET_NAME=
export DATABASE_URL='<see Database setup section below>'
export REDIS_URL='<see Redis section below>'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Sphinx Documentation Structure for Django Project
DESCRIPTION: Sets up the basic structure for Sphinx documentation including table of contents tree with conditional includes for PyCharm configuration and user documentation. Uses reStructuredText format with Sphinx directives.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/{{cookiecutter.project_slug}}/docs/index.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: restructuredtext
CODE:
```
.. {{ cookiecutter.project_name }} documentation master file, created by
   sphinx-quickstart.
   You can adapt this file completely to your liking, but it should at least
   contain the root `toctree` directive.

Welcome to {{ cookiecutter.project_name }}'s documentation!
======================================================================

.. toctree::
   :maxdepth: 2
   :caption: Contents:

   howto{% if cookiecutter.editor == 'PyCharm' %}
   pycharm/configuration{% endif %}
   users



Indices and tables
==================

* :ref:`genindex`
* :ref:`modindex`
* :ref:`search`
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

CODE:
```
$ tests/test_bare.sh use_celery=y
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Supervisor Configuration for Django Docker Deployment
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides a sample Supervisor configuration file for managing the Docker Compose deployment of a Django project. It ensures the application restarts automatically and survives system reboots.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/3-deployment/deployment-with-docker.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
[program:{{cookiecutter.project_slug}}]
command=docker compose -f docker-compose.production.yml up
directory=/path/to/{{cookiecutter.project_slug}}
redirect_stderr=true
autostart=true
autorestart=true
priority=10
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Viewing Postgres Authentication Failure Logs in Docker
DESCRIPTION: Example log output when Postgres authentication fails due to password mismatch between regenerated projects. This happens when Docker preserves volumes but credentials are regenerated.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/5-help/troubleshooting.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
postgres_1      | 2018-06-07 19:11:23.963 UTC [81] FATAL:  password authentication failed for user "pydanny"
postgres_1      | 2018-06-07 19:11:23.963 UTC [81] DETAIL:  Password does not match for user "pydanny".
postgres_1      | 	Connection matched pg_hba.conf line 95: "host all all all md5"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Nginx Proxy Service in Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for adding an nginx-proxy service to docker-compose.local.yml. This service handles HTTPS requests and forwards them to the appropriate container, enabling secure local development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally-docker.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
nginx-proxy:
  image: jwilder/nginx-proxy:alpine
  container_name: nginx-proxy
  ports:
    - "80:80"
    - "443:443"
  volumes:
    - /var/run/docker.sock:/tmp/docker.sock:ro
    - ./certs:/etc/nginx/certs
  restart: always
  depends_on:
    - node
  environment:
    - VIRTUAL_HOST=my-dev-env.local
    - VIRTUAL_PORT=3000
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Environment Variable Warning Messages in Docker
DESCRIPTION: Example warning logs showing missing environment variables when using Docker with Webpack without Whitenoise. These warnings appear when required AWS storage variables aren't configured.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/5-help/troubleshooting.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
WARN[0000] The "DJANGO_AWS_STORAGE_BUCKET_NAME" variable is not set. Defaulting to a blank string.
WARN[0000] The "DJANGO_AWS_S3_CUSTOM_DOMAIN" variable is not set. Defaulting to a blank string.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Django ALLOWED_HOSTS for HTTPS Development
DESCRIPTION: Python code snippet to add a custom domain to Django's ALLOWED_HOSTS setting in the local configuration. This allows Django to accept requests from the secure local development domain.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally-docker.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
ALLOWED_HOSTS = ["localhost", "0.0.0.0", "127.0.0.1", "my-dev-env.local"]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Including external Contributing documentation with Sphinx
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the Sphinx directive for including an external markdown file (CONTRIBUTING.md) in the documentation. The directive pulls in content from a file located at '../../CONTRIBUTING.md'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/6-about/contributing.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
{include} ../../CONTRIBUTING.md
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Rebuilding Docker Application with Local Compose File
DESCRIPTION: Command to rebuild and restart the Docker application with the local docker-compose file. This applies the HTTPS configuration changes to the running environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally-docker.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml up -d --build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building and Serving HTML Documentation with Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: Command to build and serve HTML documentation using Docker Compose. This is used when developing locally with Docker.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/4-guides/document.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ docker compose -f docker-compose.docs.yml up
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Handling Modified PyCharm Configuration Files in Git
DESCRIPTION: Command to make Git ignore changes to PyCharm configuration files while preserving the original configurations in the repository for other users. This prevents constant tracking of auto-generated IDE files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/{{cookiecutter.project_slug}}/docs/pycharm/configuration.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ git update-index --assume-unchanged {{cookiecutter.project_slug}}.iml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Future Deployment Commands
DESCRIPTION: Commands for subsequent deployments after initial setup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/3-deployment/deployment-on-pythonanywhere.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
workon my-virtualenv-name
cd project-directory
git pull
python manage.py migrate
python manage.py collectstatic
# if using django-compressor:
python manage.py compress
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating API Documentation from Docstrings
DESCRIPTION: Command to automatically compile all docstrings into documentation source files using Sphinx's apidoc functionality. This creates documentation from code comments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/{{cookiecutter.project_slug}}/docs/howto.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
make apidocs
```

TITLE: Generating API Documentation with Docker
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the apidocs generation within a Docker container, useful for maintaining consistency across development environments when generating documentation from docstrings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/{{cookiecutter.project_slug}}/docs/howto.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:

```
docker run --rm docs make apidocs
```

TITLE: Changelog Entry Format
DESCRIPTION: Standard markdown format used for changelog entries showing version numbers, dates, and categorized changes
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## 2022.01.13

### Changed
- Add UserSignupForm and UserSocialSignupForm ([#3515](https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/pull/3515))
### Fixed
- Fix high CPU usage when running `runserver_plus` in Docker ([#3531](https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/pull/3531))
- Fix out-of-sync sequence for Site ID ([#3511](https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/pull/3511))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Project Directory Structure
DESCRIPTION: A visual representation of the recommended two-tier project layout with repository root containing configuration files and Django project root containing the actual applications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/2-local-development/developing-locally.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
<repository_root>/
 config/
    settings/
       __init__.py
       base.py
       local.py
       production.py
    urls.py
    wsgi.py
 <django_project_root>/
    <name_of_the_app>/
       migrations/
       admin.py
       apps.py
       models.py
       tests.py
       views.py
    __init__.py
    ...
 requirements/
    base.txt
    local.txt
    production.txt
 manage.py
 README.md
 ...
```

----------------------------------------

```
### Updated
- Update django to 3.2.13 ([#3676](https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/pull/3676))

## 2022.04.08

### Updated
- Auto-update pre-commit hooks ([#3673](https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/pull/3673))
```

```
$ eval "$(docker-machine env dev1)"
```

```
- Not sure what happens when a deps is removed
- ~~Unable to parse classifiers without minor version~~
- ~~Creates an issue even if we are on the latest version~~
```

TITLE: Initializing and Using WebSockets in JavaScript with cookiecutter-django
DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript example demonstrates how to establish a WebSocket connection to a cookiecutter-django server, set up a message handler, and send/receive messages. It shows both local development and production connection patterns.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/docs/4-guides/websocket.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
ws = new WebSocket('ws://localhost:8000/') // or 'wss://<mydomain.com>/' in prod
WebSocket {url: "ws://localhost:8000/", readyState: 0, bufferedAmount: 0, onopen: null, onerror: null, }
ws.onmessage = event => console.log(event.data)
event => console.log(event.data)
ws.send("ping")
undefined
pong!
```

TITLE: Project Generation Interactive Prompts
DESCRIPTION: Example of the interactive prompt session when generating a new project, showing available options and sample responses for creating a Reddit clone application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
Cloning into 'cookiecutter-django'...
remote: Counting objects: 550, done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (310/310), done.
remote: Total 550 (delta 283), reused 479 (delta 222)
Receiving objects: 100% (550/550), 127.66 KiB | 58 KiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (283/283), done.
project_name [My Awesome Project]: Reddit Clone
project_slug [reddit_clone]: reddit
description [Behold My Awesome Project!]: A reddit clone.
author_name [Daniel Roy Greenfeld]: Daniel Greenfeld
domain_name [example.com]: myreddit.com
email [daniel-greenfeld@example.com]: pydanny@gmail.com
version [0.1.0]: 0.0.1
[...additional configuration options...]
```


TITLE: Compiling Translation Messages in Django (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This command compiles the translated .po files into .mo files, which are used by the application. It uses docker-compose if the project is set up with Docker.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cookiecutter/cookiecutter-django/blob/master/{{cookiecutter.project_slug}}/locale/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
{% if cookiecutter.use_docker == 'y' %}docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml run --rm django {% endif %}python manage.py compilemessages
```
